conclusion: Use the graph and kinematic equations to determine distance traveled.
From t = 0 to t = 15 seconds, acceleration is 2 m/s^2.
From t = 15 to t = 30 seconds, acceleration is 0 m/s^2.
From t = 30 to t = 60 seconds, acceleration is -1 m/s^2.
Initial velocity v0 at t = 0 seconds is 0 m/s.
Velocity at t = 15 seconds is 30 m/s.
Velocity at t = 30 seconds remains 30 m/s.
Velocity at t = 60 seconds is 0 m/s.
Distance from t = 0 to t = 15 seconds is 225 m.
Distance from t = 15 to t = 30 seconds is 450 m.
Distance from t = 30 to t = 60 seconds is 450 m.
